text:
- What does it tell
you, particularly

that there was a second
bomb that was disabled?
What does it all indicate?

PAUL CRUICKSHANK: Well,
that indicates that this was

a plot of some
ambition, the fact

that there were multiple
devices involved.
One, obviously, went off.
One was found and didn't go off.

I've had a look at the
pictures of that second device,
which was discovered.

And just by eyeballing
it, it looks

like a pretty makeshift,
improvised explosive device.

But we'll obviously
have to wait from--

to hear from the Russian
investigators who will be doing

all sorts of forensics on
just how sophisticated or not
sophisticated it was.

And, of course, the
most sophisticated

the device was, the more likely
that the perpetrators would be

trained by some kind of
terrorist organization

somewhere, perhaps in
the Russian Caucasus,

but possibly in somewhere
like Syria and Iraq.
